intro: Ethulia aquatica, commonly known as the water lily of the marshes, is a aquatic plant native to wetland environments. It features broad, floating leaves that provide shade and habitat for aquatic life. Its flowers are typically white or pink, with a fragrant scent that attracts pollinators. The plant has a rhizomatous root system that helps stabilize the soil and prevent erosion. Ethulia aquatica plays an important role in maintaining the ecological balance of its habitat.
